name: net-next-sim: ns-3 Direct Code Execution with Linux kernel
body:
## Quick start
```
 git clone git://github.com/thehajime/net-next-sim.git
 cd net-next-sim
 make defconfig ARCH=sim
 make library ARCH=sim
 make testbin -C arch/sim/test
 make test ARCH=sim
```
see what's going on.

## What is this ?
_net-next-sim_ is a shared library of Linux (net-next) kernel to integrate with userspace applications, such as ns-3 network simulator. It consists of **sim** architecture (located arch/sim/) to avoid touching the main part of Linux kernel.


## Gallery
* [mptcp Linux kernel](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fN_nv7RdFm8)
* [Mobile IPv6](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y790NE3EPCg)

## More information
* [Wiki](http://yans.pl.sophia.inria.fr/trac/DCE/wiki)
* [Direct Code Execution (DCE) project page](http://www.nsnam.org/overview/projects/direct-code-execution/)
* [Jenkins nightly build/tests](ns-3-dce.cloud.wide.ad.jp/jenkins/)
